AbstractCache

Type: Abstract Class

Description

AbstractCache<K, V>which implements Cache interface serves as a foundational implementation for key-value caching systems. It provides core storage and operations like contains, remove, clear, and size. Concrete cache strategies such as LRU, LFU, or FIFO can subclass this and define their behavior for get and put.

Use Cases

  • Common base for implementing different cache eviction strategies
  • Avoiding code duplication in concrete cache classes
  • Provides consistent null-checking and map-based storage

Method Summary

Return Type Method Description Time Complexity
boolean contains(K key) Checks if the cache contains a mapping for the given key. O(1)
void remove(K key) Removes the entry associated with the specified key from the cache. O(1)
int size() Returns the number of entries in the cache. O(1)
void clear() Clears all entries from the cache. O(1)

Abstract Methods

Return Type Method Description
V get(V key) Core get logic to be implemented by subclasses
void put(K key, V value) Core put logic to be implemented by subclasses

Sample Usage


// FIFO Cache extending AbstractCache
Cache<String, Integer> cache = new FIFOCache<>(3);
cache.put("A", 1);
cache.put("B", 2);
cache.put("C", 3);
System.out.println(cache.get("A")); // Output: 1
System.out.println(cache.contains("B")); // true
cache.remove("C");
System.out.println(cache.size()); // 2
cache.clear();

Available Implementations

  • FIFOCache - First In First Out Cache
  • LFUCache - Least frequently used frequency
  • LRUCache - Least recently use cache
  • SegmentedLRUCache - Segmented least recently used cache
